datasource: Kiessling, Roland. 1994. Eine Grammatik des Burunge. Arikanistische Forschungen 13. Hamburg: Research and Progress Verlag [K94]
geodemoTXT: Varieties and subdialects of Burunge are spoken in Tanzania, ZZDodoma region: Kondoa district, southeast of Langi [lag] language area, Goima, Chambalo, and Mirambu villages; Manyara regionZZ.

termclusters.label: brn-Verb-doosl-NegSubjunctiveProhibitativeNegative
termclusters.note: K94s9.5.2 :: Der Prohibitiv :: The prohibitive functions as the negation of the imprtv,subjunctive,and optative. Negation with -baɬi not possible. Instead,neg adv ħanti comes between selector and stem :: The tnsAspMod is imperf;can be combined with any non-preterite tenseSel.

termclusters.label: brn-Verb:morph-DervStemSuff:
termclusters.note: K94s6.3(pp.93-109) :: Derived stem template:comitative - applicative - frequentative - ROOT - distributive - {progressive,intensive}- inchoative - durative - {mediopassive,continuative}- causative :: The plural root (suppletive in a number of verbs) is often formed with a derived stem (frequentative,continuative,durative,progressivew,or intensive - cf. section 6.5.2,pp. 113 - 119 :: [The exclamation sign !is used by Kiessling as a morphophonemic indicator of (regressive or progressive) vowel shortening,and,when progressive,consonant devoicing. Cf. 4.1.11 (pp. 43f)]
terms: -VVC- [reduplication of rootFinal syllable with vowel lengthening]

termclusters.label: brn-Verb:morph-ImperativeCompAnalysis:Imperative

termclusters.label: brn-Verb:morph-InterrGen:
termclusters.note: K94s9.6.1(p.213) :: Die Satzfrage. Comparative list of morphological markers in declarative (with final reduction) and interrogative (without final reduction). On p, 214 gives list of imperative endings to make point that since imperative interrogatives do not exist, imperatives always have final reduction. Cf. pdgms: ImperativeCompAnalysis, ImperativeObject3, ImperativeApplicative.

termclusters.label: brn-Verb:morph-VerbVsAdjNeg:-ʔar-
termclusters.note: K94s9.5.3 :: Der adjektivische Charakter des Negationssuffixes -baɬi :: The following paradigm illustrates the difference between the verbal suffix -baɬi,which gets reduced to –ba in the declarative,and the adjective baɬ,which undergoes no such reduction.

termclusters.label: brn-Verb:morph-VerbalnounNeg:-doosl-Negative
termclusters.note: K94s9.5.3 :: Der adjektivische Charakter des Negationssuffixes -baɬi. This is a nominal type negative construction :: The adjectivally inflected baɬ comes inbetween the selector and the verbal noun form of the verb. Paradigm gives by way of example the second person forms.
